    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

        The entry point of the project. This method parses the command line arguments and checks for the correct type and format. If any of the arguments does not match the requirements, the programs throws an exception and exits gracefully. If everything passes, then it sets the appropriate variables with the given values.

        Parameters:
        args - It is an array of Strings. It can take any number of Strings. But for the program to work as expected, it should be passed zero or more of the these two options: -README and -print and 8 other arguments. For more details, refer Project1 Details

      • getOptionalArguments

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getOptionalArguments(java.lang.String[] args,
                                                                          int countOfArgs)
        Returns a list of Strings containing the options passed to main method via command line.
        Parameters:
        args - The command line arguments passed to main method
        countOfArgs - Count of number of command line arguments.
        Returns:
        A list of Strings containing the options.
        See Also:
        main(String[])

      • getReadMe

        private static java.lang.String getReadMe()
        Returns the README of the project, a brief description of what the project does.
        Returns:
        String containing the hard coded README.

      • checkNumberOfArguments

        private static void checkNumberOfArguments(int countOfArgs,
                                           int numberOfOptions)
        Checks if there are correct number of arguments required. If not, throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        countOfArgs - Number of command line arguments
        numberOfOptions - Number of options passed in command line

      • checkAirportCodeFormat

        private static void checkAirportCodeFormat(java.lang.String airportCode)
        Checks if the input is string of three characters. If not, throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        airportCode - A String of three lettered code for departure or arrival airport.
        Throws:
        IllegalAirportCodeException

      • checkDateFormat

        private static void checkDateFormat(java.lang.String date)
        Checks if the input String is of the format mm/dd/yyyy. Month and day can be 1 or digits, but year should be of 4 digits. It also checks if the input is a valid date. If not, throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        date - Departure date or Arrival date
        Throws:
        ErroneousDateTimeFormatException

      • checkTimeFormat

        private static void checkTimeFormat(java.lang.String time)
        Checks if the input string is of the format HH:mm. Hours can be 1 or 2 digits, but minutes should be 2 digits. It also checks if it is a valid time. If not, it throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        time -
        Throws:
        ErroneousDateTimeFormatException
